chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (p n m : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) (power p n) -> In (p, m) l -> n <= m

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
prime_divides_refactor : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) p -> exists m : nat, In (p, m) l
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
is_wf_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
is_wf_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
rel_prime_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n q m : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf ((q, m) :: l) -> rel_prime p q
cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail)
factor_divides_refactor : forall (x : nat * nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), In x l -> divides (refactor l) (power (fst x) (snd x))
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
is_pwd_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
is_pwd_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
prime_power_qn : forall p n q x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) (power p (q * n)) -> 1 <= n -> divides x (power p q)
cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail)
prime_power : forall p n x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) p -> divides x p
wf_impl_pwd : forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_pwd l
ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae_correct_aux : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) (o : RingMicromega.Op1) (v : positive), In (p, o) l -> In v (ZMicromega.vars 1 p) -> (v <= fold_left ZMicromega.F l 1)%positive
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
power_divides_power : forall x n m : nat, x > 1 -> divides (power x n) (power x m) -> m <= n
ZMicromega.max_var_nformalae_correct : forall (l : list (EnvRing.Pol Z * RingMicromega.Op1)) (p : EnvRing.Pol Z) (o : RingMicromega.Op1) (v : positive), In (p, o) l -> In v (ZMicromega.vars 1 p) -> (v <= ZMicromega.max_var_nformulae l)%positive
Inductive is_pwd : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_pwd : is_pwd nil | cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_pwd _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_pwd (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope _ _%function_scope
in_split_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (fst p) (fst (split l))
in_split_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (snd p) (snd (split l))
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
power_power_rel_prime : forall a n b m : nat, n > 0 -> m > 0 -> rel_prime (power a n) (power b m) < -> rel_prime a b
gt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n > m -> p <= m -> n > p
le_gt_trans : forall n m p : nat, m <= n -> m > p -> n > p
in_inv : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (l : list A), In b (a :: l) -> a = b \/ In b l
in_prod : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In x l -> In y l' -> In (x, y) (list_prod l l')
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
